title: Chinese steel giant Baowu looking to invest in billion-dollar project in Sri Lanka
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – China’s steel giant Baowu is to prepare a feasibility study in Sri Lanka’s southern district of Hambantota to invest in a billion-dollar project, a statement said.
Baowu Steel is a China state-owned conglomerate that is the world’s top steel producer with an annual output of over 115 million tonnes per year, according to reports.

“Ambassador of Sri Lanka to China, Dr Palitha Kohona visited the Baowu Steel conglomerate offices in Ma’anshan, Anhui and met with senior management to discuss investment potential in Sri Lanka,” Colombo’s embassy in Beijing said.
“Baowu Steel will prepare a feasibility study on making a substantial investment in Hambanthota, Sri Lanka.” (Colombo/Mar18/2022)
